intro: Cacalia trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined cacalia, is a flowering plant species native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided with three main veins, giving it the species name "trinervis." Cacalia trinervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
